catalog_info.title: To Vote or Not to Vote: voting behavior and electoral institutions
catalog_info.description: What is voting? Why do people vote? And what institutions shape voting behaviors? This course addresses these questions by combining classical work on voting behavior with less known literature on voting as protest and identity affirmation. The course also investigates voting institutions (e.g., electoral systems and compulsory voting regulations), their pathologies (e.g., vote buying and electoral fraud) and their role in shaping voting behaviors.
